properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Suggan Buggan. 

  • There is no current threat to communities.  
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Firefighters continue to monitor this fire. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 at 1600 or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: 5.5km NW of Suggan Buggan
Issue Date: Thursday 05 October 2023, 07:31 pm
Next Update: Monday 09 October 2023, 04:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/30528/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Suggan Buggan. 

- There is no current threat to communities.  
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
- Firefighters continue to monitor this fire. 


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This is a Final Minor Flood Warning for Bunyip River to Iona. 

  • No rainfall is forecast for the catchment Sunday 08 October 2023.
  • The level of the Bunyip River at Iona is currently at 1.59 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (2.10 metres) and falling. It peaked above the Minor Flood Level (2.10 metres) in the morning on Thursday 5th October 2023.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 11.50am on Saturday 7 2023.
The threat of flooding is reduced. Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and beware of hazards remaining in the warning area.
What you should do:

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never enter floodwater.

If your home or business has been flooded:
  • Check for building damage before you enter.
  • Have all electrical and gas equipment professionally tested before use.
  • Clean and dry out the building as soon as possible.

Call Triple Zero (000) in a life threatening emergency. For emergency assistance from the SES call 132 500.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Damage to roads and buildings caused by flooding may still exist in your area. 
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

This will be the last warning for this flood. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: King River At Docker Road Bridge
properties.webBody:
This is a Final Minor Flood Warning for the King River At Docker Road Bridge. 

MINOR FLOODING HAS EASED ALONG THE KING RIVER AT DOCKER ROAD BRIDGE.

No significant rainfall has been observed in the 24 hours to 9:00 am Sunday. No significant rainfall is forecast across the Ovens and King Rivers catchment over the next few days.

The King River at Docker Rd Bridge is currently at 3.49 metres and falling, below the minor flood level. The King River at Docker Rd Bridge is expected to remain below the minor flood level (3.70 m).
The threat of flooding is reduced. Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and beware of hazards remaining in the warning area.
What you should do:

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never enter floodwater.

If your home or business has been flooded:
  • Check for building damage before you enter.
  • Have all electrical and gas equipment professionally tested before use.
  • Clean and dry out the building as soon as possible.

Call Triple Zero (000) in a life threatening emergency. For emergency assistance from the SES call 132 500.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Damage to roads and buildings caused by flooding may still exist in your area. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) for road closures and follow instructions from emergency services.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

This will be the last warning for this flood. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Mitchell River downstream of Glenaladale.

MINOR FLOODING OCCURRING AT BAIRNSDALE AND EASING AT GLENALADALE

Flood levels along the Wonnangatta River at Waterford and along the Mitchell River at Glenaladale continue to fall.

Moderate flooding has eased at Bairnsdale where minor flooding is now occurring.In the 24 hours to 9:00 am Saturday no significant rainfall has been recorded. 

No further rainfall of significance is expected across the Mitchell River catchment over the next few days Mitchell River downstream of Glenaladale:

Minor flooding is occurring along the Mitchell River downstream of Glenaladale.

The Mitchell River at Bairnsdale is currently at 5.27 metres and steady, with minor flooding. 

The Mitchell River at Bairnsdale is likely to remain above the minor flood level (4.00 m) for the remainder of Saturday andinto Sunday.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Some roads in the area may still be closed due to flood water. Travel through flood water is dangerous. Refer to Vic traffic website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au  
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings. 
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams. 
  • Local roads may remain closed and low bridges may be underwater.
  • For more information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 08/10/2023 02:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Yarra River from Millgrove to Coldstream
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Yarra River from Millgrove to Coldstream

The Yarra River catchment has recorded rainfall averaging 0mm in the upper part of the catchment as well as in the lower part of the catchment since 09:00 AM Saturday 07 October 2023. 
No rainfall is forecast for the catchment for Sunday 08 October 2023. Water levels in the lower part of the Yarra River at various locations are rising in response to the rain.

Yarra River from Millgrove to Coldstream:
  • The level of the Yarra River at Coldstream is currently at 4.62 metres, exceeding the Minor Flood Level (4.00 metres) and falling slowly. 
  • It is expected to drop below the Minor Flood Level (4.00 metres) tomorrow, Monday 9th October.

This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 12:29 PM. 
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
  • Monitor weather forecasts and river levels. Go to www.bom.gov.au/vic/warnings/
Impacts in your area: 

  • Minor flooding in the Yarra catchment is expected to affect low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway including bicycle paths.

This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Broken River downstream of Casey Weir
properties.webBody:
This is a Final Minor Flood Warning for the Broken River downstream of Casey Weir. 

FLOODING EASED AT ORRVALE.

River levels along the Broken River are easing at Orrvale, where river levels are below the minor flood level.

No significant rainfall has been observed since 9:00 am Saturday. No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days.

The Broken River at Orrvale peaked at 7.78 metres around Saturday morning, above the moderate floodlevel (7.20 m). The river level is currently at 6.59 metres and falling, below the minor flood level (6.80 m). The Broken River at Orrvale is expected to remain below the minor flood level (6.80 m).
The threat of flooding is reduced. Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and beware of hazards remaining in the warning area.
What you should do:
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never enter floodwater.

If your home or business has been flooded:
  • Check for building damage before you enter.
  • Have all electrical and gas equipment professionally tested before use.
  • Clean and dry out the building as soon as possible.

Call Triple Zero (000) in a life threatening emergency. For emergency assistance from the SES call 132 500.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Damage to roads and buildings caused by flooding may still exist in your area. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) for road closures and follow instructions from emergency services.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

This will be the last warning for this flood. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This is a Final Minor Flood Warning for Seven Creeks downstream of Euroa. 

MINOR FLOODING HAS EASED AT KIALLA WEST

Minor flooding has eased along Seven Creeks at Kialla West. No significant rainfall has been recorded in the 24 hours to 9 am Sunday. No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days.

The Seven Creeks at Kialla West is currently at 4.43 metres and falling, below the minor flood level. The Seven Creeks at Kialla West is likely to remain below the minor flood level (4.50 m).
The threat of flooding is reduced. Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and beware of hazards remaining in the warning area.
What you should do:

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never enter floodwater.

If your home or business has been flooded:
  • Check for building damage before you enter.
  • Have all electrical and gas equipment professionally tested before use.
  • Clean and dry out the building as soon as possible.

Call Triple Zero (000) in a life threatening emergency. For emergency assistance from the SES call 132 500.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Damage to roads and buildings caused by flooding may still exist in your area. 
  • Parks, hiking tracks and campgrounds are closed due to flooding. To find out more go to www.parkweb.vic.gov.au/safety/flood-affected-parks.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

This will be the last warning for this flood. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Moderate Flood Warning is being issued for Thomson River downstream of Wandocka.

MODERATE FLOODING CONTINUES TO EASE AT SALE WHARF
Moderate flooding is slowly easing along the Thomson River at Sale Wharf.
No significant rainfall has been recorded in the 24 hours to 9:00 am Sunday.
No significant rainfall is forecast across the Thomson River catchment over the next few days.
Thomson River downstream of Wandocka: Moderate flooding is occurring along the Thomson River downstream of Wandocka.
The Thomson River at Sale Wharf is currently at 3.05 metres and falling, with moderate flooding.
The Thomson River at Sale Wharf is likely to fall below the moderate flood level (3.00 m) early Sunday afternoon.
The river level is likely to remain above the minor flood level (2.40 m) during Monday.
Stay safe - avoid the flooded area. Be aware of potential hazards caused by flooding and never enter floodwater.

What you should do:
  • Monitor weather forecasts and river levels. Go to www.bom.gov.au/vic/warnings/
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never enter floodwater.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
If you choose to leave:
  • Remember to take your pets, mobile phone, spare clothes and medications.
  • Travel to the home of family or friends who are in a safe location, away from flooding.
  • Turn off gas and electricity at your home or workplace.
  • Be aware of any road closures when you leave.
If you are travelling:
  • Do not enter flooded areas. Turn around a find a safe alternative route.
  • Be aware of road hazards including mud, debris and damaged roads or bridges.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
If you stay or if it is unsafe to leave:
  • Make sure you have enough food, drinking water, medications and pet food to survive for three to five days in case you become isolated.
  • Use plugs, sandbags or household items to block toilets, sinks and drains to stop sewerage backflow.
  • Lift it - move valuables and vital household items up on high surfaces, such as on top of tables, chairs, benches and beds.

Impacts in your area:

Impacts in your area:
  • Main roads and bridges may be closed due to flooding.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) for road closures and follow instructions from emergency services.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
  • Community Information (click to find contact numbers for community services)

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the Goulburn River Seymour to Shepparton.

MINOR FLOODING OCCURRING AT DOWNSTREAM LAKE EILDON, SEYMOUR AND SHEPPARTON

Goulburn Murray Water has advised the releases from Lake Eildon are likely to remain around 17,000 ML/d during for the remainder of Sunday and into Monday.

The Goulburn River at Shepparton peaked at 9.82 metres around 03:00 am Sunday. The river level is currently at 9.81 metres and steady, with minor flooding. The Goulburn River at Shepparton is expected to remain above the minor flood level (9.50 m) for the remainder Sunday and into Monday.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Farmers should consider moving livestock and machinery to higher ground.
  • Review your emergency plan and check your emergency kit is fully stocked, if you have one.
  • Contact family members and neighbours to ensure they are aware of the situation.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Some local roads may be closed and low bridges may be underwater.
  • Low lying caravan parks and camping grounds may be flooded.
  • Watt Road and Raftery Road Shepparton start to flood at 8.75m.
  • Watts Road, between McClennan Street and Old Tip Road has been closed due to floodwater. 
  • For more information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)

properties.text:
ADVICE - RIVERINE FLOOD - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Goulburn River Seymour to Shepparton
Issue Date: Sunday 08 October 2023, 11:46 am
Next Update: Monday 09 October 2023, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/30724/moreinfo

This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the Goulburn River Seymour to Shepparton.

MINOR FLOODING OCCURRING AT DOWNSTREAM LAKE EILDON, SEYMOUR AND SHEPPARTON 

Goulburn Murray Water has advised the releases from Lake Eildon are likely to remain around 17,000 ML/d during for the remainder of Sunday and into Monday.

The Goulburn River at Shepparton peaked at 9.82 metres around 03:00 am Sunday. The river level is currently at 9.81 metres and steady, with minor flooding. The Goulburn River at Shepparton is expected to remain above the minor flood level (9.50 m) for the remainder Sunday and into Monday. 

Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Yarra River from Warrandyte to Abbotsford
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Yarra River from Warrandyte to Abbotsford.

  • The level of the Yarra River at Templestowe is currently at 2.43 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (3.50 metres), and steady. 
  • It is expected to peak below the Minor Flood Level (3.50 metres) today, Sunday 8th October.The level of the Yarra River at Heidelberg is currently at 5.44 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (6.00 metres), and rising slowly. 
  • It is expected to peak around the Minor Flood Level (6.00 metres) today, Sunday 8th October.
  • The level of the Yarra River at Alphington is currently at 2.32 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (3.00 metres), and rising slowly. 
  • It is expected to peak around the Minor Flood Level (3.00 metres) tomorrow, Monday 9th October.
  • The level of the Yarra River at Abbotsford is currently at 2.04 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (2.70 metres), and rising. 
  • It is expected to peak around the Minor Flood Level (2.70 metres) tomorrow, Monday 9th October.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
  • Monitor weather forecasts and river levels. Go to www.bom.gov.au/vic/warnings/
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Stagnant water can be harmful to your health. Don’t swim, drink or wash in stagnant water.
  • Parks, hiking tracks and campgrounds are closed due to flooding. To find out more go to www.parkweb.vic.gov.au/safety/flood-affected-parks.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Yarra River from Coldstream to Warrandyte
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the Yarra River from Coldstream to Warrandyte.

The Yarra River catchment has recorded rainfall averaging 0mm in the upper part of the catchment as well as in the lower part of the catchment since 09:00 AM Saturday 07 October 2023. 
No rainfall is forecast for the catchment for Sunday 08 October 2023. 
Water levels in the lower part of the Yarra River at various locations are rising in response to the rain.

  • The level of the Yarra River at Yarra Glen is currently at 4.48 metres, exceeding the Minor Flood Level (4.10 metres) and falling very slowly.   
  • It is expected to drop below the Minor Flood Level (4.00 metres) tomorrow, Monday 9th October.

  • The level of the Yarra River at Christmas Hills is currently at 2.50 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (3.00 metres), and falling.  
  • It peaked above the Minor Flood Level (2.10 metres) yesterday late evening, Saturday 7th October 2023. 

  • The level of the Yarra River at Warrandyte is currently at 2.37 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (3.00 metres), and steady.  
  • It is expected to peak below the Minor Flood Level (3.00 metres) today, Sunday 8th October. 

  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 11:28 AM, Saturday 7 October. 
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
Impacts in your area:

  • Minor flooding in the Yarra catchment is expected to affect low-lying areas adjacent to the waterway including bicycle paths.
  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Culloden, Fernbank, Glenaladale, Iguana Creek, Moornapa, Munro, Stockdale, Walpa, Woodglen, Cobbannah, Lindenow South
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Cobbannah, Culloden, Fernbank, Glenaladale, Iguana Creek, Lindenow South, Moornapa, Munro, Stockdale, Walpa, Woodglen and surrounding areas.

  • The bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong is not yet under control.
  • Recent rain has dampened fire activity. However, there is still active fire within the area as logs and trees continue to burn.
  • You may see isolated pockets of flames and smoke over the burnt area.
  • Firefighters are monitoring the area.
  • Several roads are still closed due to active fire and hazardous trees.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Duffy Rd, Briagolong Issue Date: Friday 06 October 2023, 04:55 pm Next Update: Monday 09 October 2023, 06:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/30656/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for Cobbannah, Culloden, Fernbank, Glenaladale, Iguana Creek, Lindenow South, Moornapa, Munro, Stockdale, Walpa, Woodglen and surrounding areas. - The bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong is not yet under control. - Recent rain has dampened fire activity. However, there is still active fire within the area as logs and trees continue to burn. - You may see isolated pockets of flames and smoke over the burnt area. - Firefighters are monitoring the area. - Several roads are still closed due to active fire and hazardous trees. - Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Goulburn River from Eildon to Seymour
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Goulburn River from Eildon to Seymour.

MINOR FLOODING OCCURRING AT DOWNSTREAM LAKE EILDON AND SEYMOUR

Goulburn Murray Water has advised the releases from Lake Eildon are likely to remainaround 17,000 ML/d during for the remainder of Sunday and into Monday.

No significant rainfall has been observed since 9:00 am Saturday. No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days.

Minor flooding is occurring along the Goulburn River from downstream Lake Eildon to Seymour. Minor flooding is occurring at Trawool.

The Goulburn River downsteam Lake Eildon is currently at 3.40 metres and steady, with minor flooding. Based on Goulburn Murray Water's planned releases from Lake Eildon, the Goulburn River downstream Lake Eildon is likely to remain above the minor flood level (3.00 metres) for the remainder of Sunday and into Monday.

The Goulburn River at Seymour is currently at 4.20 metres and falling, with minor flooding. The Goulburn River at Seymour is likely to remain above the minor flood level (3.80 m) for the remainder of Sunday and into Monday.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Review your emergency plan and check your emergency kit is fully stocked, if you have one.
  • Contact family members and neighbours to ensure they are aware of the situation.
  • Farmers should consider moving livestock, pumps and machinery to higher ground.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
Eildon to Seymour: At Minor flood level 3.8 m on the Seymour Gauge:

  • The Goulburn River Caravan Park at Seymour may start to flood low lying parts.
  • The Caravan Parks at Molesworth and the Breakaway Caravan Park at Acheron has enacted their emergency plans.
  • Localised flooding along the river frontage between Kings Park and the old Hume Highway.   
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.location: Kiewa River downstream of Mongans Bridge
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Kiewa River downstream of Mongans Bridge.

MINOR FLOODING CONTINUING AT KIEWA RIVER DOWNSTREAM OF MONGANS BRIDGE.

The Kiewa River at Kiewa (Main Stream) is currently at 3.33 metres and steady, with minor flooding. The Kiewa River at Kiewa (Main Stream) is likely to fall below the minor flood level (3.30 m) overnight Sunday into Monday.

The Kiewa River at Bandiana is currently at 2.89 metres and steady, with minor flooding. The Kiewa River at Bandiana is likely to remain above the minor flood level (2.80 m) for the remainder of Sunday and into Monday.

No significant rainfall was recorded across the Kiewa catchment for the 24 hours to 11:00 am Sunday. No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Local roads may be closed and low bridges may be underwater. For information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 01:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

properties.location: Macalister River downstream of Lake Glenmaggie
properties.webBody:
This Flood Watch is being issued for Macalister River downstream of Lake Glenmaggie.

  • Flooding is no longer expected.
FLOODING HAS EASED ALONG THE MACALISTER RIVER

No significant rainfall has been recorded across the Macalister River catchment since 9:00 am Saturday. 

No further significant rainfall is forecast.Macalister River downstream of Lake Glenmaggie:No further flooding is expected in the Macalister River downstream of Lake Glenmaggie.

The Macalister River downstream Lake Glenmaggie is currently at 2.15 metres and steady, below the minor flood level (2.60 m). 

The Macalister River D/S Lake Glenmaggie is expected to remain below the minor flood level(2.60 m)

The threat of flooding is reduced. You can now return to normal activity, but be aware of any hazards that may still exist in the warning area.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

This will be the last warning issued for this flood.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Mitchell River to Glenaladale.

MINOR FLOODING OCCURRING AT BAIRNSDALE AND EASING AT GLENALADALE

Flood levels along the Wonnangatta River at Waterford and along the Mitchell River at Glenaladale continue to fall.

Moderate flooding has eased at Bairnsdale where minor flooding is now occurring. In the 24 hours to 9:00 am Saturday no significant rainfall has been recorded. 

No further rainfall of significance is expected across the Mitchell River catchment over the next few days.

Mitchell River to Glenaladale:

Minor flooding is easing along the Mitchell River to Glenaladale.The Mitchell River at Glenaladale is currently at 3.06 metres and steady, with minor flooding The Mitchell River at Glenaladale is likely to fall below the minor flood level (3.00 m) during Saturday
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never drive, walk or ride through floodwater.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  •  Heavy rainfall may lead to an increased risk of landslides – be aware of fallen earth, rocks, debris or trees.
  • Local roads may be closed and low bridges may be underwater.
  • For more information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
  • Stagnant water can be harmful to your health. Don’t swim, drink or wash in stagnant water.
  • Parks, hiking tracks and campgrounds may be closed due to flooding. To find out more go to www.parkweb.vic.gov.au/safety/flood-affected-parks.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 08/10/2023 02:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the Ovens Rivers downstream of Rocky Point.

MINOR FLOODING CONTINUING ALONG THE OVENS RIVER AT WANGARATTA

Moderate flooding has eased along the Ovens River at Wangaratta, where minor flooding is continuing. River levels are steady but continue to fall slowly.

No significant rainfall has been observed in the 24 hours to 9:00 am Sunday. No significant rainfall is forecast across the Ovens and King Rivers catchment over the next few days.

The Ovens River at Wangaratta is currently at 12.23 metres and steady, with minor flooding. The Ovens River at Wangaratta is likely to fall below the minor flood level (11.90 m) Monday morning.

Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Caravan parks and camping grounds may be flooded. 
  • For more information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 09/10/2023 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au

This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the Ovens Rivers downstream of Rocky Point.

MINOR FLOODING CONTINUING ALONG THE OVENS RIVER AT WANGARATTA 

Moderate flooding has eased along the Ovens River at Wangaratta, where minor flooding is continuing. River levels are steady but continue to fall slowly.

No significant rainfall has been observed in the 24 hours to 9:00 am Sunday. No significant rainfall is forecast across the Ovens and King Rivers catchment over the next few days. 

The Ovens River at Wangaratta is currently at 12.23 metres and steady, with minor flooding. The Ovens River at Wangaratta is likely to fall below the minor flood level (11.90 m) Monday morning. 


Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Ovens Rivers downstream of Rocky Point

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon.

MODERATE FLOODING HAS EASED AND MINOR FLOODING TO CONTINUE AT THOMS BRIDGE DURING SATURDAY

MINOR FLOODING TO CONTINUE AT ROSEDALE INTO NEXT WEEK

No significant rainfall has been recorded in the 24 hours to 9 am Saturday in the Latrobe catchment.  No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days. 

Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon:

Minor flooding is occurring along the Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon.

The Latrobe River at Rosedale (Main Stream) is currently at 4.34 metres and steady, above the minor flood level (4.00 m).   

The Latrobe River at Rosedale (Main Stream) is likely to remain above the minor flood level(4.00 m) for the next few days.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • You should stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Floodwater is toxic - never play or swim in floodwater.
Impacts in your area: 

  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
  • Stagnant water can be harmful to your health. Don’t swim, drink or wash in stagnant water.
  • For more information on road closures check the VicRoads website traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 08/10/2023 01:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

MODERATE FLOODING HAS EASED AND MINOR FLOODING TO CONTINUE AT THOMS BRIDGE DURING SATURDAY

MINOR FLOODING TO CONTINUE AT ROSEDALE INTO NEXT WEEK

No significant rainfall has been recorded in the 24 hours to 9 am Saturday in the Latrobe catchment.  No significant rainfall is forecast for the next few days. 

Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon:
Minor flooding is occurring along the Latrobe River downstream of Traralgon.

The Latrobe River at Rosedale (Main Stream) is currently at 4.34 metres and steady, above the minor flood level (4.00 m).

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This is a Final Minor Flood Warning for Bunyip River downstream of Iona. 

  • No rainfall is forecast for the catchment on Sunday 8 October 2023.
  • The level of the Bunyip River at Cora Lynn is currently at 3.04 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (3.10 metres) and falling slowly. It peaked above the Minor Flood Level (3.10 metres) around midday on Thursday 5th October 2023.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 11.52am on Saturday 7 October. 
The threat of flooding is reduced. Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and beware of hazards remaining in the warning area.
What you should do:

  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Floodwater is dangerous - never enter floodwater.

If your home or business has been flooded:
  • Check for building damage before you enter.
  • Have all electrical and gas equipment professionally tested before use.
  • Clean and dry out the building as soon as possible.

Call Triple Zero (000) in a life threatening emergency. For emergency assistance from the SES call 132 500.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Damage to roads and buildings caused by flooding may still exist in your area. 
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

This will be the last warning for this flood. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - RIVERINE FLOOD - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Bunyip River downstream of Iona
Issue Date: Sunday 08 October 2023, 01:44 pm
Next Update: Monday 09 October 2023, 01:50 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/30738/moreinfo

This is a Final Minor Flood Warning for Bunyip River downstream of Iona. 

- No rainfall is forecast for the catchment on Sunday 8 October 2023. 
- The level of the Bunyip River at Cora Lynn is currently at 3.04 metres, below the Minor Flood Level (3.10 metres) and falling slowly. It peaked above the Minor Flood Level (3.10 metres) around midday on Thursday 5th October 2023. 
- This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 11.52am on Saturday 7 October. 


The threat of flooding is reduced. Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and beware of hazards remaining in the warning area.
